Transmit status report if block can't be processed

Discard block if it can't be processed

Reporting node accepted custody of bundle

registry.title: Ciphersuite Parameters and Results Type Registry

record.description: Allocated to the Space Assigned Numbers Authority (SANA) for use by Consultative Committee for Space Data Systems (CCSDS) missions.

Allocated to Spacely Packets, LLC to provide IPN/IP Gateway services to private sector stakeholders.
Allocated to SPATIAM CORPORATION to provide DTN services to organizations.
Allocated to Phoenix R&D GMBH to provide DTN services for secure messaging.
Allocated to LateLab AB for various terrestrial DTN deployments and services.
Allocated to MEIS d.o.o. from Slovenia for various terrestrial DTN testbeds.
Allocated to Digital Health Information Network Inc. for Space applications in digital health and terrestrial DTN services.

Allocated to Shirokuma-AI for artificial intelligence-driven space applications and terrestrial DTN services in the fields of healthcare, robotics, wearables and edge devices, information processing and discovery.
Assigned to LJCV Electronics for Development of an Experimental R&D DTN, STEM Education, space and terrestrial applications.
Allocated to TCT Networks Corporation to provide space and terrestrial DTN services to organizations.
Allocated to Bull Reef Aquaculture for underwater sensing, automation, and coral reef/climate change research applications.

XRTC-based terrestrial and interplanetary end-to-end DTN communication services to simplify mission planning and implementation by providing standardized data transmission services across agencies, institutions, contractors and suppliers.
Assigned to Intuitive Machines for terrestrial and Lunar Data Network DTN services.
Allocated to Opal Labs for terrestrial DTN HIL testbeds.
Allocated to the SUNY Polytechnic Institute College of Engineering for conducting academic research in applying Delay/Disruption Tolerant Networking to Networks in Challenging Environments.
Allocated to Critical Technologies Inc. for R&D and initial operational deployments of trustworthy networked autonomous cyber-physical systems.
Allocated to the Clarkson Open Source Institute (COSI) at Clarkson University for conducting academic research on networks in challenging environments.
Allocated to Viagenie to provide DTN services to organizations.
Intuitive Machines Bundle Protocol Routing and Network Architecture Research
Allocated to Comtron Space Software, Mar del Plata, Argentina for developing, testing and deploying software applications for space and earth using DTN.

registry.title: Bundle Protocol TCP Convergence-Layer Version Numbers
Bundle Protocol TCP Convergence-Layer Message Types

record.description: Indicates the transmission of a segment of bundle data, as described in Section 5.2.
Acknowledges reception of a data segment, as described in Section 5.3.
Indicates that the transmission of the current bundle shall be stopped, as described in Section 5.4.
KEEPALIVE message for the connection, as described in Section 5.6.
Indicates that one of the nodes participating in the connection wishes to cleanly terminate the connection, as described in Section 6.
Contains the length (in bytes) of the next bundle, as described in Section 5.5.

registry.title: Bundle Protocol TCP Convergence-Layer REFUSE_BUNDLE Reason Codes

record.semantics: Reason for refusal is unknown or not specified.
The receiver now has the complete bundle. The sender may now consider the bundle as completely received.
The receiver's resources are exhausted. The sender SHOULD apply reactive bundle fragmentation before retrying.
The receiver has encountered a problem that requires the bundle to be retransmitted in its entirety.

registry.title: Bundle Protocol TCP Convergence-Layer SHUTDOWN Reason Codes

record.description: The connection is being closed due to idleness.
The node cannot conform to the specified TCPCL protocol version.
The node is too busy to handle the current connection.
